review: I have tried every device under the sun. I do NOT have cable - so I depend on 100% streaming and an HD antennae.I have AppleTV, Roku, GoogleTV variants, Chromecast and every other one out there.  I am sick and tired of Apple's dooshfest and locking all of your media into their world. So I walked away. AppleTV is easy to use ... but I have grown to hate their business model.So ... FireTV ... It is BLAZING FAST. The movies are cheaper. You can choose SD instead of HD and save $1 ... and there is not much difference. So movies are really $2.99 to rent. The apps are improving ... so I use Chromecast ($34.99) to supplement FireTV as they expand. There is NOTHING that I need between FireTV and Chromecast.I have kids ... so it is even more challenging. They are fine ... no issues.  We rent movies, use Netflix, share HBO, Netflix, HuluPlus with family members ... so it is affordable. It sure beats paying $170/mo for cable ... and now only about $60 for high-speed internet ... so we are saving $100/mo ... so even if we purchased 30 SD movies a month ... we are still saving money over cable. Its a no-brainer. Cut the cord.My parents are retired ... and they cut the chord too ... no problem. It is easy to use.
